step_1_critical_12_issues: Add grid-cols-1 base + sm: breakpoint to ALL grid layouts
Ensure max-w-full or max-w-sm for modal/card containers
Hide decorative absolute elements on mobile with hidden sm:absolute
Convert fixed-width tables to overflow-x-auto or card layout on mobile
Add responsive flex-direction (flex-col sm:flex-row) to layout components
Ensure all SVG/chart containers recalculate dimensions on resize
step_2_high_priority_28_issues: Add sm: responsive variants to ALL padding (px-*, py-*)
Ensure touch targets are minimum 44px (p-2 = 32px, p-2.5 = 40px, p-3 = 48px)
Review and adjust grid column counts for tablet sizes
Convert any multi-column layouts to responsive with gap adjustment
Test button/input interactions on actual mobile devices
Ensure text is readable at 12px minimum (text-xs = 12px)
Add max-w constraints to long-text elements
step_3_medium_priority_35_issues: Optimize font sizes with responsive variants (text-xs sm:text-sm)
Review and adjust vertical spacing (gap, margin) for mobile
Ensure images have responsive sizing (max-w-full object-cover)
Test image layouts on various aspect ratios
Verify text truncation with line-clamp utilities
Check form input widths and heights on mobile
Optimize icon sizes for touch interaction (w-5 h-5 minimum for tappable)
step_4_low_priority_12_issues: Fine-tune spacing and padding on mobile vs desktop
Optimize animation timing for mobile devices
Improve scroll experience with snap-scroll or indicators
Add haptic feedback considerations for mobile
Verify accessibility on mobile screen readers

manual_testing_points: All grids stack to single column
Modals fit on screen without cutoff
automated_checks: Verify all text has appropriate contrast
Run responsive design mode in DevTools

quick_wins_order: 1. Fix critical grid layouts (AIDoctor, OfficerDashboard, Marketplace)
2. Add responsive padding variants to all containers
6. Test all components at multiple screen sizes
refactoring_strategy: Use search/replace to add responsive classes in batches
Build a responsive utility class reference
tailwind_best_practices: Use consistent responsive breakpoints (sm:, md:, lg:)
Apply max-w-* to containers for consistency
Use w-full with max-w constraint, not fixed widths
Ensure padding scales: p-3 sm:p-4 md:p-6
Flex: flex-col sm:flex-row for wrapping layouts
Always include touch target sizing (44px minimum)

conclusion.summary: The Govi-Isuru application has significant mobile responsiveness gaps affecting 87 components/areas. Critical issues involve missing responsive breakpoints on grid layouts, fixed widths, and absolute positioning that breaks on mobile. The application needs systematic refactoring using mobile-first Tailwind approach.
conclusion.overall_mobile_readiness: Poor (45%) - Requires substantial work before mobile production release
conclusion.recommendation: Implement fixes in priority order: Critical (12) → High (28) → Medium (35) → Low (12). Focus on grid systems, touch targets, and spacing first. Estimate 50-70 hours of development + testing time.
